definitions: To take a firm stand; to insist on something; to use one's authority to stop something or make something happen.
To accelerate a vehicle by pressing the accelerator pedal to the floor.
examples: She had to put her foot down with her children about their screen time.
The company finally put its foot down on the new policy.
He put his foot down and sped away.
If you don't put your foot down, they'll take advantage of you.
